result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: as the reducer.To ensure direct contact of the TiO 2 catalyst with CO 2 and gaseous water, the as-prepared photocatalysts were first treated in 500 C to desorb the gas and burn off the surfactant residual on the surface and then allowed to equilibrate in the CO 2 H 2 O atmosphere for several hours to ensure that the adsorption of gas molecules was complete.During irradiation at room temperature, about 0.5 mL of gas was continually taken from the reaction cell at given time intervals for subsequent CH 4

of CO 2 , 0.1 g of the TiO 2 catalyst was uniformly dispersed onto the glass reactor with an area of 5.4 cm 2 .A 300 W mercury lamp was used as the light source of the photocatalytic reaction.The volume of the reaction system was about 270 mL.The reaction setup was vacuum-treated several times, and then the high purity of CO 2 gas was followed into the reaction setup for reaching ambient pressure.A total of 1 mL of deionized water was injected into the reaction system as the reducer.To ensure direct

analysis shows that CH 4 was exclusively obtained as the reduction product without detectable CH 3 OH, H 2 , and CO as secondary products.The gross yield in CH 4 increased with the photolysis time (Fig. 4), and the total yield of CH 4 of TiO 2 -RMA obtained in the experiment after 8 h of continuous irradiation was 18.9 molg.A conversion experiment of CO 2 performed in the dark or in the absence of the photocatalyst shows no appearance of CH 4 , proving that the reduction reaction of CO 2 is driven by light

samples were recorded at room temperature, by a Bruker D8 advance X-ray diffractometer using Cu K radiation and 2 scan rate of 6 min -1 .Diffraction patterns were taken over the 2 range 20-70.FESEM images were obtained by a JEOL JEM-6700F Field Emission Scanning Electron Microscope. Transmission electron microscopy and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy images were obtained by a JEOL JEM-2010FEF Field Emission Electron Microscope. In the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 , 0.1 g of the TiO 2

of CO 2 is driven by light under the photocatalyst.In comparison, TiO 2 -A shows low photocatalytic activity toward methane production 10.3 molg after 8 h UV light irradiation.And the CH 4 generation of TiO 2 -RMA is very close to that of TiO 2 -A with 1 wt.Pt loading as shown in Fig. 4a. The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

analysis shows that CH 4 was exclusively obtained as the reduction product without detectable CH 3 OH, H 2 , and CO as secondary products.The gross yield in CH 4 increased with the photolysis time (Fig. 4), and the total yield of CH 4 of TiO 2 -RMA obtained in the experiment after 8 h of continuous irradiation was 18.9 molg.A conversion experiment of CO 2 performed in the dark or in the absence of the photocatalyst shows no appearance of CH 4 , proving that the reduction reaction of CO 2 is driven by light

4 of TiO 2 -RMA obtained in the experiment after 8 h of continuous irradiation was 18.9 molg.In comparison, TiO 2 -A shows low photocatalytic activity toward methane production 10.3 molg after 8 h UV light irradiation.And the photocatalytic mechanism of TiO 2 -RMA also was discussed.
